<Sa'id ibn Makhlad
1:
ere are the triplets extracted from the text:

<Sa'id ibn Makhlad
2:
--------------------
Text: Sa'id ibn Makhlad:  He rose to prominence during the regency of al-Muwaffaq over his brother, the Caliph al-Mu'tamid (r. 870–892): between 878 and 885, he served as "de facto" vizier of the Caliphate, although he did not bear the title.
Triplets:<Sa'id ibn Makhlad
3:
--------------------
Text: Sa'id ibn Makhlad:  His valuable assistance to al-Muwaffaq was recognized in 882 by the award of the unique honorific title Dhu'l-Wizaratayn ("possessor of the two vizierates"), with which he appears even on coins.
Triplets:<Sa'id ibn Makhlad
4:
ere are the triplets extracted directly from the text:

<Sa'id ibn Makhlad
5:
--------------------
<Text: Sa'id ibn Makhlad:  He died in 889.>
Triplets:<Sa'id ibn Makhlad
